issue.title: Multiple DRCSim issues, including p3d and Camera plugin missing includes 2.5, and 2.6.1
Multiple DRCSim issues, including p3d and Camera plugin missing includes 2.5, and 2.6.1
Multiple DRCSim issues, including p3d and Camera plugin missing includes 2.5, and 2.6.1

content.raw:
None of the console output provided here should cause any problems.  We're working right now on cleaning up that output, so that users aren't distracted by errors or warnings for conditions that are expected.

When you say that the simulator "barely runs," what do you mean?  Depending on your internet connection, startup can take tens of seconds if models need to be downloaded from the online model database.  Once it's running, what's your real-time factor?  You can see this in the GUI, in the "Real Time Factor" text box at the bottom, or you can run the `gzstats` tool at the command line.

I'm guessing that you have a very low real-time factor, perhaps caused by software rendering due to an unsupported GPU.
content.html:
None of the console output provided here should cause any problems. We're working right now on cleaning up that output, so that users aren't distracted by errors or warnings for conditions that are expected.

When you say that the simulator "barely runs," what do you mean? Depending on your internet connection, startup can take tens of seconds if models need to be downloaded from the online model database. Once it's running, what's your real-time factor? You can see this in the GUI, in the "Real Time Factor" text box at the bottom, or you can run the gzstats tool at the command line.

I'm guessing that you have a very low real-time factor, perhaps caused by software rendering due to an unsupported GPU.

issue.title: Multiple DRCSim issues, including p3d and Camera plugin missing includes 2.5, and 2.6.1

content.raw:
Real Time Factor started out at 0.04, and after 6 seconds real time factor changed to 0.03. What was meant by barely runs means its slow, and it frequently pops up a message dialog that says not responding. Additionally, the instructions on http://www.ros.org/wiki/stereo_image_proc?distro=fuerte for stereo_image_procs returns an empty image screen (i.e. - no images load, and the canvas stays gray.).

Graphics Processor is:  Intel GMA 4500MHD Dynamic Video Memory Technology 5.0
I'll see if I can find Linux drivers for this GPU.

Thanks,


Aaron
content.html:
Real Time Factor started out at 0.04, and after 6 seconds real time factor changed to 0.03. What was meant by barely runs means its slow, and it frequently pops up a message dialog that says not responding. Additionally, the instructions on http://www.ros.org/wiki/stereo_image_proc?distro=fuerte for stereo_image_procs returns an empty image screen (i.e. - no images load, and the canvas stays gray.).

Graphics Processor is: Intel GMA 4500MHD Dynamic Video Memory Technology 5.0 I'll see if I can find Linux drivers for this GPU.

Thanks,

Aaron

issue.title: Multiple DRCSim issues, including p3d and Camera plugin missing includes 2.5, and 2.6.1

content.raw:
Ah, you have an Intel GPU, and an RTF that low suggests that you're using software rendering because the card isn't fully supported for OpenGL operations.

You should really get an NVIDIA GPU instead.  While things can be made to work on other kinds of GPU, it's a painful and error-prone process.  Much easier to buy/borrow an NVIDIA card.
content.html:
Ah, you have an Intel GPU, and an RTF that low suggests that you're using software rendering because the card isn't fully supported for OpenGL operations.

You should really get an NVIDIA GPU instead. While things can be made to work on other kinds of GPU, it's a painful and error-prone process. Much easier to buy/borrow an NVIDIA card.

content.raw: Thanks gerkey, unfortunately I have a laptop with an integrated gpu, and no additional slots to add hardware. Do you know if Ubuntu AWS 64-bit images emulate nVidia cards well enough?
